title: Fix: Ollama API requests not cancelled when user clicks cancel
body: ## Description Fixes #7468 This PR adds proper cancellation support to the Ollama provider, allowing users to stop generation immediately when clicking the cancel button. ## Problem When using Ollama and clicking the cancel button during generation: - API request continues running in the background - High GPU usage persists until generation naturally completes - Following requests stall/block waiting for the previous request to finish - Resources are wasted on unwanted generation ## Root Cause The Ollama provider lacked any cancellation mechanism. When the task detected user cancellation (`this.taskState.abort = true`), it would break out of the for-await loop, but the underlying `client.chat()` stream would keep generating tokens server-side with no way to stop it. ## Solution ### 1. Added AbortController to Ollama Provider **File**: `src/core/api/providers/ollama.ts` **Changes**: - Added `currentAbortController` field to track the active request - Create new AbortController for each `createMessage()` call - Race API request against both timeout AND abort promises - Check abort signal inside the stream processing loop - Clean up controller in finally block **Code**: ```typescript // Create new AbortController for this request this.currentAbortController = new AbortController() const abortController = this.currentAbortController // Create abort promise that rejects when signal fires const abortPromise = new Promise((_, reject) => { abortController.signal.addEventListener("abort", () => { reject(new Error("Ollama request cancelled by user")) }) }) // Race against timeout and abort const stream = await Promise.race([apiPromise, timeoutPromise, abortPromise]) // Check for cancellation in loop for await (const chunk of stream) { if (abortController.signal.aborted) { throw new Error("Ollama request cancelled by user") } // ... yield chunks } ``` ### 2. Added `abortCurrentRequest()` Method Public method that triggers cancellation: ```typescript public abortCurrentRequest(): void { if (this.currentAbortController) { console.log("Aborting current Ollama request...") this.currentAbortController.abort() } } ``` ### 3. Call Abort from Task Cancellation **File**: `src/core/task/index.ts` Added call to `abortCurrentRequest()` when user cancels: ```typescript // Cancel ongoing API request if using Ollama if (this.api && typeof (this.api as any).abortCurrentRequest === "function") { try { ;(this.api as any).abortCurrentRequest() } catch (error) { Logger.error("Failed to abort API request during task abort", error) } } ``` ## How It Works **Before**: ``` User clicks cancel ‚Üì taskState.abort = true ‚Üì for-await loop breaks ‚Üì Ollama keeps generating ‚ùå ‚Üì GPU stays busy ‚Üì Next request blocks ``` **After**: ``` User clicks cancel ‚Üì taskState.abort = true ‚Üì abortCurrentRequest() called ‚Üì AbortController fires abort event ‚Üì Promise rejects with cancellation error ‚Üì Stream stops immediately ‚úÖ ‚Üì GPU freed ‚Üì Next request can proceed ``` ## Testing ### Manual Testing - ‚úÖ Start Ollama generation, click cancel mid-stream - ‚úÖ Verified GPU usage drops immediately after cancel - ‚úÖ Following requests no longer stall - ‚úÖ Error properly propagated as "cancelled by user" (not timeout/API error) - ‚úÖ Tested with local Ollama server ### Edge Cases - ‚úÖ Cancellation before stream starts - ‚úÖ Cancellation during stream processing - ‚úÖ Multiple rapid cancel clicks - ‚úÖ Normal completion (no cancel) still works - ‚úÖ Timeout still works independently ## Impact - **Risk**: Low - only affects Ollama provider, uses optional method check - **Value**: High - fixes major UX/performance issue for Ollama users - **Compatibility**: Full - other providers unaffected, method is optional ## Checklist - [x] Code follows project style guidelines - [x] Fix addresses the root cause - [x] Tested with Ollama provider - [x] Backward compatible (optional method) - [x] Error handling for cancellation - [x] Cleanup in finally block - [x] Clear console logging ## Related Issues Closes #7468 --- ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code) Co-Authored-By: Claude ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Adds `AbortController` to `OllamaHandler` for immediate API request cancellation on user action, improving resource management. > > - **Behavior**: > - Adds `AbortController` to `OllamaHandler` in `ollama.ts` to cancel API requests when user clicks cancel. > - Introduces `abortCurrentRequest()` method to trigger cancellation. > - Updates `Task` class in `index.ts` to call `abortCurrentRequest()` on task cancellation. > - **Implementation**: > - `createMessage()` in `ollama.ts` now races API requests against timeout and abort promises. > - Checks for abort signal within stream processing loop. > - Cleans up `AbortController` in `finally` block. > - **Testing**: > - Manual tests confirm immediate GPU usage drop and no stalling of subsequent requests. > - Handles edge cases like cancellation before stream starts and multiple rapid cancel clicks. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=cline%2Fcline&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for c120d26487a1d1da259fddf517b89396800a899a. You can [customize](https://app.ellipsis.dev/cline/settings/summaries) this summary. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

title: Fix: Terminal commands with double quotes broken in Background Exec mode
body: ## Description Fixes #7470 This PR resolves an issue where terminal commands containing double quotes were being over-escaped when using "Background Exec" mode, causing commands to fail. ## Problem When "Terminal Execution Mode" is set to "Background Exec", commands containing double quotes were improperly escaped: - `echo "test"` became `echo \"test\"` (failed to execute) - `type "test.txt"` became `type \"test.txt\"` (failed to execute) The issue affected all non-Claude AI models that output JSON-escaped strings. ## Root Cause AI models were outputting commands with JSON-style escaped quotes (`\"` instead of `"`), and these weren't being unescaped before being passed to the shell. The existing `applyModelContentFixes()` function only handled HTML escaping (`"`), not JSON escaping (`\"`). ## Solution ### 1. Added `fixCommandEscaping()` function **File**: `src/utils/string.ts` New utility function that unescapes JSON-style escaped characters: - `\"` ‚Üí `"` - `\'` ‚Üí `'` - `\\` ‚Üí `\` ### 2. Added `applyModelCommandFixes()` function **File**: `src/core/task/tools/utils/ModelContentProcessor.ts` New specialized function for terminal commands that applies: - JSON escape fixing (via `fixCommandEscaping()`) - HTML escape fixing (existing `fixModelHtmlEscaping()`) - Invalid character removal (existing `removeInvalidChars()`) ### 3. Updated command execution handler **File**: `src/core/task/tools/handlers/ExecuteCommandToolHandler.ts` Changed from: ```typescript if (config.api.getModel().id.includes("gemini")) { command = applyModelContentFixes(command) } ``` To: ```typescript const modelId = config.api.getModel().id if (!modelId.includes("claude")) { command = applyModelCommandFixes(command, modelId) } ``` Now applies to **all non-Claude models** (not just Gemini), ensuring consistent command escaping. ## Testing ### Manual Testing - ‚úÖ Verified `echo "test"` properly executes in Background Exec mode - ‚úÖ Tested with both Windows (cmd.exe/PowerShell) and Unix shells - ‚úÖ Confirmed fix works with multiple AI models (Gemini, GPT, etc.) - ‚úÖ Verified Claude model behavior unchanged (skip processing) ### Edge Cases Handled - Double backslashes: `echo \\` ‚Üí `echo \` - Mixed quotes: `echo "foo" 'bar'` ‚Üí `echo "foo" 'bar'` - Already-correct commands: `echo test` ‚Üí `echo test` (no change) ## Impact - **Low risk**: Only affects command preprocessing for non-Claude models - **High value**: Fixes broken terminal commands for all affected users - **No regressions**: Claude models bypass the new logic entirely ## Checklist - [x] Code follows project style guidelines - [x] Fix addresses the root cause - [x] Works across platforms (Windows/Unix) - [x] Handles edge cases - [x] No regressions for Claude models - [x] Clear, documented code with comments ## Related Issues Closes #7470 --- ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code) Co-Authored-By: Claude ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Fixes over-escaped quotes in terminal commands for non-Claude models in Background Exec mode by introducing JSON-style unescaping. > > - **Behavior**: > - Fixes over-escaped quotes in terminal commands for non-Claude models in Background Exec mode. > - Commands like `echo "test"` are now correctly processed as `echo "test"`. > - **Functions**: > - Adds `fixCommandEscaping()` in `src/utils/string.ts` to unescape JSON-style characters. > - Introduces `applyModelCommandFixes()` in `ModelContentProcessor.ts` to apply command-specific fixes. > - **Handlers**: > - Updates `ExecuteCommandToolHandler.ts` to use `applyModelCommandFixes()` for non-Claude models. > - **Testing**: > - Verified on Windows and Unix shells, ensuring no change for Claude models. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=cline%2Fcline&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 33e6dcc26c8ab80b3676233cdbbecac4a11aaf7d. You can [customize](https://app.ellipsis.dev/cline/settings/summaries) this summary. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

title: Terminal commands with double quotes are broken when "Terminal Execution Mode" is set to "Background Exec"
body: ### Plugin Type VSCode Extension ### Cline Version 3.37.1 ### What happened? Hello, I want to report that Cline's terminal is broken when the "Terminal Execution Mode" option is set to "Background Exec". Whenever a command is run that contains double quotes `"`, Cline automatically escapes every single instance of the double quote in the command. In addition to that, any backslash used to escape the double quote is also auto escaped. This leads to commands breaking. Example: ### Steps to reproduce 1. Go to "Settings" -> "Terminal" -> "Terminal Execution Mode" -> "Background Exec" 2. Ask Cline to run a command that contains a double quote (e.g. `echo "\""` or `type "test.txt"`) 3. Notice that the command fails due to the double quotes being escaped wrongly - `echo "\""` -> `echo \"\\\"\"` - `type "test.txt"` -> `type \"test.txt\"` (fails) ### Provider/Model lmstudio:qwen3-coder-30b-a3b-instruct@q4_k_xl ### System Information OS: Windows 10 CPU: Intel Core i9-7980XE GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 Ti & NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4060 Ti RAM: 64GB DDR4

title: Sonnet 4.5 with Claude Code provider - list_files missing path parameter
body:
### Plugin Type

VSCode Extension

### Cline Version

Cline v3.37.1

### What happened?

Environment:
- Cline: latest version
- Provider: Claude Code (Claude Max)
- Model: claude-sonnet-4-5
- Extended Thinking: OFF (tested both ON and OFF)
- Mode: Both Plan and Act mode affected

Bug:
Sonnet 4.5 repeatedly calls list_files without the required 'path' parameter.
The thinking block shows the AI knows it needs to provide path, but the 
actual tool call is missing the parameter.

### Steps to reproduce

1. New task with Sonnet 4.5 + Claude Code
2. Ask to "show folder structure" or use @src/path mention
3. AI attempts list_files without path parameter
4. Retry loop begins

Expected: list_files should include path parameter
Actual: Repeated "missing parameter path" errors

Note: Same project works fine with other models/providers.

title: wip: focus diff preview for write-to-file changes
body:
- Add DiffUtils.createFocusedDiff to generate context-aware diffs (default 5 lines)
- Use focused diff in WriteToFileToolHandler partial and approval messages using diffViewProvider.originalContent + newContent
- Fall back to existing diff/content when focused diff is unavailable

This improves readability of change previews, reduces noise on large files, and provides clearer context around edits without overwhelming the UI.

title: add docker setup for cli development
body: ### Description Add docker container build for the cli. Compiles the standalone and cli from source and launches it in a Linux container. Adds convenience scripts for building and running the shell inside the instance. ### Test Procedure Test that the cli can be configured with the auth command and used within the container. ### Type of Change - [ ] üêõ Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - [x] ‚ú® New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) - [ ] üí• Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected) - [ ] ‚ôªÔ∏è Refactor Changes - [ ] üíÖ Cosmetic Changes - [ ] üìö Documentation update - [ ] üèÉ Workflow Changes ### Pre-flight Checklist - [x] Changes are limited to a single feature, bugfix or chore (split larger changes into separate PRs) - [x] Tests are passing (`npm test`) and code is formatted and linted (`npm run format && npm run lint`) - [ ] I have created a changeset using `npm run changeset` (required for user-facing changes) - [x] I have reviewed [contributor guidelines](https://github.com/cline/cline/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) ### Screenshots ### Additional Notes ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Add Docker setup for CLI development with Dockerfile, scripts, and package.json updates for multi-platform support. > > - **Docker Setup**: > - Add `Dockerfile` to build a Docker image for the CLI with multi-architecture support using `TARGETARCH`. > - Add `.dockerignore` to exclude unnecessary files from the Docker context. > - **Scripts**: > - Add `build-docker-dev.mjs` to build the Docker image using pre-built binaries from `dist-standalone`. > - Add `docker-shell.mjs` to manage Docker container lifecycle and provide an interactive shell. > - **Package.json**: > - Add `build:docker:dev` and `docker:shell` scripts for building the Docker image and running the shell. > - **Misc**: > - Update `package-standalone.mjs` to include `linux-arm64` in `TARGET_PLATFORMS`. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=cline%2Fcline&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for a07554f19165119035f179df4282764da3fb1c94. body:
### Plugin Type

VSCode Extension

### Cline Version

 3.36.1

### What happened?

Interacting with the Cline agent in VSCode Insiders seems to function normally until the agent invokes a terminal session, causing the agent panel to go blank until the terminal is killed. This is reproducible in VSC insiders but not in GA version.

[AIKIDO-2025-10459](https://app.aikido.dev/issues/16500429/detail?groupId=39595#AIKIDO-2025-10459)
| 
MEDIUM
| Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Token Expiration Bypass due to a logic flaw in `expiresAt` verification. The token validation logic incorrectly bypasses expiration checks when `authInfo.expiresAt` is set to `0`, as the condition `!authInfo.expiresAt` evaluates to false, skipping ... | | 
[AIKIDO-2025-10583](https://app.aikido.dev/issues/16500429/detail?groupId=39595#AIKIDO-2025-10583)
| 
MEDIUM
| Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS). A malicious authorization server could supply OAuth endpoints with unsafe URL schemes (e.g., `javascript:`, `data:`, or `file:`), which, when processed by OAuth clients, could enable XSS or remote code execution (RCE) at... | | 
[CVE-2025-64118](https://app.aikido.dev/issues/17437830/detail?groupId=39595#CVE-2025-64118)
| 
MEDIUM
| node-tar is a Tar for Node.js. In 7.5.1, using .t (aka .list) with { sync: true } to read tar entry contents returns uninitialized memory contents if tar file was changed on disk to a smaller size while being read. This vulnerability is fixed in 7.5.2. | ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Fixes security vulnerabilities by updating `@modelcontextprotocol/sdk` and overriding `tar` version in `package.json`. > > - **Security Fixes**: > - Update `@modelcontextprotocol/sdk` from `^1.11.1` to `^1.21.1` to fix token expiration bypass (AIKIDO-2025-10459). > - Override `tar` to version `7.5.2` to fix uninitialized memory access vulnerability (CVE-2025-64118). > - **Misc**: > - Add `tar-fs` override to ensure compatibility with `tar` changes. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=cline%2Fcline&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 095546730c7be5307462e469aaf439cd4728326c. title: New UI is a huge downgrade in UX/DX - auto approve popups cover buttons, missing MCP visibility
body:
### Plugin Type

VSCode Extension

### Cline Version

3.35.0

### What happened?

The new UI update has introduced several usability issues that make it much harder to use. The auto approve toggle section has hideous popups that cover buttons, requiring users to enter from the side instead of normally. Additionally, users can no longer see all their MCPs, and many quick-access features that were previously available are now gone. The user describes this as a "huge downgrade" and wants to keep the interface "super simple".

### Steps to reproduce

1. Update to the latest version of Cline
2. Try to access the auto approve toggle section
3. Observe that popups cover buttons and make normal interaction impossible
4. Try to view MCP configurations
5. Notice that not all MCPs are visible anymore

### Provider/Model

cline / x-ai/grok-code-fast-1

### System Information

VSCodium: 1.102.2, Node.js: v22.15.1, Architecture: x64

title: Move native tools decision to per-model level
body: Migrates info about Native Tools from variants/families down to the model level. - Allows for more fine granular control whether native tool calls can be done for a specific model. Multi-model providers such as lmstudio, ollama, cline, vertex, openrouter... benefit from this. - Allows to activate native tools on future models in an easier way LM Studio provider: reads model capabilities and looks for tool_use capability ### Related Issue **Issue:** #7424 ### Description ### Test Procedure ### Type of Change - [ ] üêõ Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - [x] ‚ú® New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) - [ ] üí• Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected) - [x] ‚ôªÔ∏è Refactor Changes - [ ] üíÖ Cosmetic Changes - [ ] üìö Documentation update - [ ] üèÉ Workflow Changes ### Pre-flight Checklist - [x] Changes are limited to a single feature, bugfix or chore (split larger changes into separate PRs) - [ ] Tests are passing (`npm test`) and code is formatted and linted (`npm run format && npm run lint`) - [x] I have created a changeset using `npm run changeset` (required for user-facing changes) - [x] I have reviewed [contributor guidelines](https://github.com/cline/cline/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) ### Screenshots ### Additional Notes Prompt generation tests are failing. Help/Contributors requested. ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Moves native tools decision to model level, updates `LMStudioProvider` for model capabilities, and modifies proto and state management for finer control. > > - **Behavior**: > - Moves native tools decision from variants/families to model level for finer control. > - Updates `LMStudioProvider` to read model capabilities and handle `tool_use` capability. > - **Proto and API Changes**: > - Adds `can_use_tools` field to `OpenRouterModelInfo`, `OcaModelInfo`, `OpenAiCompatibleModelInfo`, and `LiteLLMModelInfo` in `models.proto`. > - Updates `convertApiConfigurationToProto` and `convertProtoToApiConfiguration` in `api-configuration-conversion.ts` to handle `lmStudioCapabilities`. > - **State Management**: > - Adds `lmStudioCapabilities` to `Settings` in `state-keys.ts`. > - **UI Changes**: > - Updates `LMStudioProvider.tsx` to display model capabilities and handle changes. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=cline%2Fcline&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 8121bb2276c2f80073808a8fe00b7b5890cec0c8. You can [customize](https://app.ellipsis.dev/cline/settings/summaries) this summary. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

title: Native tools not being used in LMStudio
body:
### Plugin Type

VSCode Extension

### What happened?

I cannot see the native tools being used in LM Studio.

I am trying to use the ibm-granite (tiny) model locally through LM Studio. It has been trained for tool use, and it has the tool_use capability (advertised by LM Studio in the model info). title: feat: add BurnCloud provider metadata
body: ### Related Issue **Discussion:** #6296 ### Description - We are adding complete BurnCloud provider integration to Cline. **Problem Solved:** - Users with BurnCloud API access couldn't use it with Cline - Missing provider option for BurnCloud in the settings UI **Changes Introduced:** 1. **New BurnCloud Provider Handler** (`src/core/api/providers/burncloud.ts`) - Extends OpenAIHandler to support multi models via BurnCloud API - Validates API key requirements - Configures client with BurnCloud-specific base URL 2. **Complete State Management Integration** - Added BurnCloud configuration fields to all state layers (type definitions, read/write operations) - API key stored securely in VS Code secrets storage (encrypted) - Base URL and model IDs stored in global state - Support for separate plan/act mode model configurations - Task-level configuration overrides 3. **UI Components** (`webview-ui/src/components/settings/providers/BurncloudProvider.tsx`) - Secure API key input field - Base URL configuration - Model selection dropdowns for plan and act modes - Follows existing provider UI patterns 4. **Model Support** (`src/shared/api.ts`) - Claude Sonnet 4.5, 4, 3.7, 3.5 - Claude Opus 4, 3 - Claude Haiku 3.5, 3 - Complete model metadata (context windows, pricing, capabilities) 5. **Proto Layer Integration** - Added BurnCloud fields to protobuf definitions - Proper conversion between proto and application types ### Test Procedure **Testing Approach:** 1. **Compilation & Type Safety** - ‚úÖ All TypeScript type checks pass (`npm run check-types`) - ‚úÖ All linting checks pass (`npm run lint`) - ‚úÖ Build completes successfully (`npm run compile`) 2. **State Management Flow** - Verified API key is properly read from VS Code secrets storage on initialization - Verified API key is properly written to secrets storage when saved - Verified base URL and model IDs persist to global state - Checked debounced persistence (500ms delay) works correctly - Confirmed in-memory cache provides instant reads 3. **Data Flow Verification** - Traced complete flow: UI input ‚Üí handlers ‚Üí proto conversion ‚Üí StateManager ‚Üí storage - Verified `setApiConfiguration` includes BurnCloud fields in batch updates - Verified `getApiConfiguration` returns BurnCloud fields from cache - Confirmed BurnCloudHandler receives correct API key and base URL 4. **Integration Points Checked** - ‚úÖ Proto definitions include BurnCloud fields - ‚úÖ Proto conversions handle BurnCloud fields (toProto/fromProto) - ‚úÖ StateManager reads BurnCloud fields on initialization - ‚úÖ StateManager writes BurnCloud fields on save - ‚úÖ UI component uses correct field names - ‚úÖ Provider factory registers BurnCloudHandler 5. **Potential Breaking Points Addressed** - **API key validation**: Handler properly throws error if API key is missing - **State persistence**: Batch updates ensure data is saved to disk - **Type safety**: All fields have proper TypeScript definitions - **Backward compatibility**: New fields are optional, won't break existing configurations ### Type of Change - [ ] üêõ Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - [x] ‚ú® New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) - [ ] üí• Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected) - [ ] ‚ôªÔ∏è Refactor Changes - [ ] üíÖ Cosmetic Changes - [ ] üìö Documentation update - [ ] üèÉ Workflow Changes ### Pre-flight Checklist - [x] Changes are limited to a single feature, bugfix or chore (split larger changes into separate PRs) - [x] Tests are passing (`npm test`) and code is formatted and linted (`npm run format && npm run lint`) - [x] I have created a changeset using `npm run changeset` (required for user-facing changes) - [x] I have reviewed [contributor guidelines](https://github.com/cline/cline/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) ### Screenshots ### Additional Notes ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Integrates BurnCloud provider into the system with API handling, state management, UI components, and model support. > > - **Behavior**: > - Adds `BurnCloudHandler` in `src/core/api/providers/burncloud.ts` for BurnCloud API integration, supporting multiple models and API key validation. > - Updates `StateManager.ts` to handle BurnCloud API key and configuration in state management. > - Adds BurnCloud provider option in `ApiOptions.tsx` and UI components in `BurncloudProvider.tsx`. > - **Models**: > - Adds BurnCloud models to `api.ts`, including Claude and GPT series with metadata like context windows and pricing. > - Updates `api-configuration-conversion.ts` for proto conversion support for BurnCloud fields. > - **UI**: > - Adds UI components for BurnCloud configuration in `BurncloudProvider.tsx`, including API key input and model selection. > - Integrates BurnCloud into provider dropdown in `ApiOptions.tsx`. > - **Proto**: > - Updates `models.proto` to include BurnCloud fields for API key and base URL. > - Ensures proto conversion functions in `api-configuration-conversion.ts` handle BurnCloud fields. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=cline%2Fcline&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for d8f591e8411b680aab086f956ba5e8e506afb88a. title: Cline: URL not displayed properly during response generation.
body:
### Plugin Type

VSCode Extension

### Cline Version

3.36.1762863045

### What happened?

While testing the URL handling feature in Cline, it was observed that URLs added in the chat (e.g., @www.google.com) are not rendered or displayed properly during response generation.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open Visual Studio Code and install the Cline extension.
2. Log in to Cline.
3. Enter any query and execute it.
4. After the query completes, add any URL (e.g., @www.google.com) and ask Cline to open it in Chrome.
5. Verify how the URL appears in the Cline chat window.

### Observed:
The URL is not displayed properly while Cline is generating a response. It appears truncated or misaligned in the chat window.

### Expected: 
The URL should be clearly visible and properly formatted in the Cline chat during and after response generation.

### Note: This issue is also reproducible in the JetBrains (JB) extension as well.

import socket
import json
import time
import threading

class ModManagerTester:
    def __init__(self, host='127.0.0.1', port=38274):
        self.host = host
        self.port = port
        self.running = False
        
    def send_command(self, command, parameters=None):
        client = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
        
        try:
            client.connect((self.host, self.port))
            
            command_obj = {
                "command": command,
                "parameters": parameters or {}
            }
            
            command_json = json.dumps(command_obj)
            client.send(command_json.encode('utf-8'))
            
            response = client.recv(1024).decode('utf-8')
            return json.loads(response)
        
        except ConnectionRefusedError:
            print("Connection refused. Is ModManagerBridge running?")
            return None
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Error: {e}")
            return None
        finally:
            client.close()
    
    def test_commands(self):
        # ÊµãËØïËé∑ÂèñmodÂàóË°®
        print("Getting mod list...")
        response = self.send_command("get_mod_list")
        print(f"Mod list status: {response.get('status') if response else 'No response'}")
        
        if response and response.get("status") == "success":
            mods = response.get("data", [])
            print(f"Found {len(mods)} mods:")
            enabled_count = 0
            for mod in mods[:10]:  # Âè™ÊòæÁ§∫Ââç10‰∏™mod‰ª•ÈÅøÂÖçËæìÂá∫ËøáÂ§ö
                name = mod.get('name', 'Unknown')
                enabled = mod.get('enabled', False)
                version = mod.get('version', 'Unknown')
                author = mod.get('author', 'Unknown')
                status = "ENABLED" if enabled else "DISABLED"
                if enabled:
                    enabled_count += 1
                print(f"  - {name} ({status}) - Version: {version}, Author: {author}")
            
            if len(mods) > 10:
                print(f"  ... and {len(mods) - 10} more mods")
            
            print(f"Total: {len(mods)} mods, {enabled_count} enabled")
            
            # Ëé∑ÂèñÊØè‰∏™modÁöÑËØ¶ÁªÜ‰ø°ÊÅØÔºà‰ªÖÂØπÂâç3‰∏™ÂêØÁî®ÁöÑmodËøõË°åÊµãËØïÔºâ
            tested_mods = 0
            for mod in mods:
                if mod.get('enabled', False) and tested_mods < 3:
                    mod_name = mod.get('name', 'Unknown')
                    print(f"\nGetting info for mod: {mod_name}")
                    mod_info = self.send_command("get_mod_info", {"modName": mod_name})
                    if mod_info and mod_info.get("status") == "success":
                        data = mod_info.get("data", {})
                        name = data.get('name', 'Unknown')
                        enabled = data.get('enabled', False)
                        version = data.get('version', 'Unknown')
                        author = data.get('author', 'Unknown')
                        status = "ENABLED" if enabled else "DISABLED"
                        print(f"  Mod Info: {name} ({status}) - Version: {version}, Author: {author}")
                    else:
                        print(f"  Failed to get info for mod: {mod_name}")
                    tested_mods += 1
                
                # Â∞ùËØïÂêØÁî®ÂíåÁ¶ÅÁî®‰∏Ä‰∏™modÔºà‰ªÖÊµãËØï‰∏ÄÊ¨°Ôºâ
                if tested_mods == 1 and mod.get('name'):
                    mod_name = mod.get('name')
                    print(f"\nTesting enable/disable for mod: {mod_name}")
                    
                    # Á¶ÅÁî®mod
                    print(f"Disabling mod: {mod_name}")
                    disable_result = self.send_command("disable_mod", {"modName": mod_name})
                    print(f"Disable result: {disable_result.get('status') if disable_result else 'No response'} - {disable_result.get('message', '') if disable_result else ''}")
                    
                    time.sleep(0.5)
                    
                    # ÂêØÁî®mod
                    print(f"Enabling mod: {mod_name}")
                    enable_result = self.send_command("enable_mod", {"modName": mod_name})
                    print(f"Enable result: {enable_result.get('status') if enable_result else 'No response'} - {enable_result.get('message', '') if enable_result else ''}")
                    
                    time.sleep(0.5)
        
    def continuous_test(self, interval=5):
        self.running = True
        print(f"Starting continuous test every {interval} seconds. Press Ctrl+C to stop.")
        
        try:
            while self.running:
                print("\n" + "="*50)
                print("Running test cycle...")
                self.test_commands()
                print(f"Test cycle completed. Waiting {interval} seconds...")
                time.sleep(interval)
        except KeyboardInterrupt:
            print("\nContinuous test stopped.")
            self.running = False
    
    def run_interactive_mode(self):
        print("Interactive Mode - Type 'help' for available commands")
        while True:
            try:
                user_input = input("\n> ").strip()
                if not user_input:
                    continue
                    
                if user_input.lower() == 'quit':
                    break
                elif user_input.lower() == 'help':
                    print("Available commands:")
                    print("  get_mod_list          - Get list of all mods with status")
                    print("  get_mod_info <name>   - Get info for specific mod")
                    print("  enable_mod <name>     - Enable a mod")
                    print("  disable_mod <name>    - Disable a mod")
                    print("  quit                  - Exit interactive mode")
                elif user_input.startswith("get_mod_list"):
                    response = self.send_command("get_mod_list")
                    if response:
                        if response.get("status") == "success":
                            mods = response.get("data", [])
                            print(f"Found {len(mods)} mods:")
                            for mod in mods:
                                name = mod.get('name', 'Unknown')
                                enabled = mod.get('enabled', False)
                                version = mod.get('version', 'Unknown')
                                author = mod.get('author', 'Unknown')
                                status = "ENABLED" if enabled else "DISABLED"
                                print(f"  - {name} ({status}) - Version: {version}, Author: {author}")
                        else:
                            print(f"Error: {response.get('message', 'Unknown error')}")
                    else:
                        print("Failed to get mod list")
                elif user_input.startswith("get_mod_info "):
                    mod_name = user_input[len("get_mod_info "):].strip()
                    response = self.send_command("get_mod_info", {"modName": mod_name})
                    if response:
                        if response.get("status") == "success":
                            mod_info = response.get("data", {})
                            name = mod_info.get('name', 'Unknown')
                            enabled = mod_info.get('enabled', False)
                            version = mod_info.get('version', 'Unknown')
                            author = mod_info.get('author', 'Unknown')
                            status = "ENABLED" if enabled else "DISABLED"
                            print(f"Mod Info:")
                            print(f"  Name: {name}")
                            print(f"  Status: {status}")
                            print(f"  Version: {version}")
                            print(f"  Author: {author}")
                        else:
                            print(f"Error: {response.get('message', 'Unknown error')}")
                    else:
                        print(f"Failed to get info for mod: {mod_name}")
                elif user_input.startswith("enable_mod "):
                    mod_name = user_input[len("enable_mod "):].strip()
                    response = self.send_command("enable_mod", {"modName": mod_name})
                    if response:
                        status = response.get('status')
                        message = response.get('message', 'Unknown error')
                        print(f"Status: {status}")
                        print(f"Message: {message}")
                    else:
                        print(f"Failed to enable mod: {mod_name}")
                elif user_input.startswith("disable_mod "):
                    mod_name = user_input[len("disable_mod "):].strip()
                    response = self.send_command("disable_mod", {"modName": mod_name})
                    if response:
                        status = response.get('status')
                        message = response.get('message', 'Unknown error')
                        print(f"Status: {status}")
                        print(f"Message: {message}")
                    else:
                        print(f"Failed to disable mod: {mod_name}")
                else:
                    print("Unknown command. Type 'help' for available commands.")
                    
            except KeyboardInterrupt:
                break
            except EOFError:
                break
        
        print("Exiting interactive mode.")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    tester = ModManagerTester()
    
    print("ModManagerBridge Continuous Test Script")
    print("=" * 40)
    print("Choose mode:")
    print("1. Single test run")
    print("2. Continuous test")
    print("3. Interactive mode")
    
    try:
        choice = input("Enter choice (1-3): ").strip()
        
        if choice == "1":
            tester.test_commands()
        elif choice == "2":
            interval = input("Enter interval in seconds (default 5): ").strip()
            interval = int(interval) if interval.isdigit() else 5
            tester.continuous_test(interval)
        elif choice == "3":
            tester.run_interactive_mode()
        else:
            print("Invalid choice. Running single test...")
            tester.test_commands()
            
    except KeyboardInterrupt:
        print("\nScript interrupted.")
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error: {e}")

import json

def send_command(command, parameters=None):
    client = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
    
    try:

title: fix(sapaicore): SAP AI Core streaming inference requests fail
body: The fetch adapter from getAxiosSettings() is incompatible with axios responseType: 'stream'. This caused SAP AI Core streaming inference requests to fail. Root cause: Commit b4ea1a17 added getAxiosSettings() to all axios calls for proxy support, but the fetch adapter doesn't properly support Node.js streams that the streaming response handler expects. Solution: Remove getAxiosSettings() only from the streaming request (line 681) while keeping it for non-streaming requests (authentication, deployment fetching, o3-mini). This maintains proxy support where needed while fixing streaming functionality. Fixes streaming inference for all SAP AI Core models except o3-mini. ### Related Issue **Issue:** #7367 ### Description ### Test Procedure manually tested SAP AI Core Streaming Models (e.g. Claude) ### Type of Change - [x] üêõ Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - [ ] ‚ú® New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) - [ ] üí• Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected) - [ ] ‚ôªÔ∏è Refactor Changes - [ ] üíÖ Cosmetic Changes - [ ] üìö Documentation update - [ ] üèÉ Workflow Changes ### Pre-flight Checklist - [x] Changes are limited to a single feature, bugfix or chore (split larger changes into separate PRs) - [x] Tests are passing (`npm test`) and code is formatted and linted (`npm run format && npm run lint`) - [ ] I have created a changeset using `npm run changeset` (required for user-facing changes) - [x ] I have reviewed [contributor guidelines](https://github.com/cline/cline/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) ### Screenshots ### Additional Notes ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Fixes SAP AI Core streaming inference requests by removing incompatible fetch adapter setting from streaming requests in `sapaicore.ts`. > > - **Behavior**: > - Fixes SAP AI Core streaming inference requests by removing `getAxiosSettings()` from the streaming request in `sapaicore.ts`. > - Maintains `getAxiosSettings()` for non-streaming requests (authentication, deployment fetching, o3-mini). > - **Misc**: > - Fixes streaming inference for all SAP AI Core models except `o3-mini`. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=cline%2Fcline&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for ae66f00e9bf32784998f8bd2f3b0608efb8298d4. title: üêõ Bug: Mermaid Node Text Labels are Incomplete or Clipped After Zooming
body:
### Plugin Type

VSCode Extension

### Cline Version

v3.36.1 (Feature introduced in v3.4.0)

### What happened?

When clicking on a Mermaid diagram in the Cline chat window to view the enlarged version, the generated PNG image has the following issues:
- ‚ùå The content of node text labels is missing or clipped (on the right and bottom edges).
- ‚úÖ The diagram structure (node borders, connecting lines) renders correctly.

The inline preview works correctly; the issue only occurs when zooming in.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Send a message containing a Mermaid code block in the chat.
2. Click on the rendered diagram to enlarge it.
3. Observe the node text in the opened PNG image.

**Test Case**
```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A["Node A"] --> B["Node B"]
    B --> C["Node C"]
```

### Provider/Model

It's not a model-related problem.

### System Information

It's not a system-related problem.


## Here are some information I collected assisted with AI:


**Potential Cause Analysis (AI-assisted)**

**üî¥ Primary Issue: `foreignObject` Compatibility Problem**

Since v9.2, Mermaid defaults to using HTML `foreignObject` elements to render text labels in flowcharts. When the `svgToPng` function uses `canvas.drawImage()` to convert the SVG from a Data URL, browser security policies prevent the HTML content within the `foreignObject` from rendering correctly. This leads to missing or incomplete node text labels.

This explains why the diagram's structure (native SVG elements) is rendered completely, while the text labels (content within `foreignObject`) are lost.

**üü° Secondary Issue: Implementation Problems in the `svgToPng` Function**

Location: `webview-ui/src/components/common/MermaidBlock.tsx:168-223`

1.  **Incorrect Size Calculation**: Obtaining `clientWidth/clientHeight` from a cloned SVG that is not attached to the DOM may return 0 or inaccurate values (lines 175-176).
2.  **Missing Bounding Box Method**: Should use `getBBox()` or `getBoundingClientRect()` on the original (rendered) SVG to get accurate dimensions.
3.  **Font Loading Timing**: Does not wait for `document.fonts.ready`, which may cause fonts to be incompletely loaded at the time of rendering.
4.  **Lack of Padding**: No padding is added, which can lead to content at the edges being clipped.

**Suggested Fixes**:
- ‚úÖ Disable `foreignObject` by adding `flowchart: { htmlLabels: false }` to the `mermaid.initialize()` configuration.
- ‚úÖ Add `useMaxWidth: false` to prevent automatic scaling from affecting the export.

**Relevant Code Locations**
- Mermaid Configuration: `webview-ui/src/components/common/MermaidBlock.tsx:39-77`
- SVG Conversion Logic: `webview-ui/src/components/common/MermaidBlock.tsx:168-223`
- Size Calculation Reference: `webview-ui/src/components/common/Thumbnails.tsx:23-28`

**Technical Background**
- Since v9.2, Mermaid defaults to using `foreignObject` with an HTML `div` to render text labels.
- The rendering of `foreignObject` by the canvas `drawImage()` method is restricted by browser security policies.
- Using `htmlLabels: false` forces Mermaid to use native SVG `<text>` elements, which are fully compatible with Canvas.

title: Claude Code provider throws "tool_use is not supported yet" error causing task execution failures
body:
### Plugin Type

VSCode Extension

### Cline Version

3.35.1

### What happened?

When using the Claude Code API provider, any attempt to use interactive tools (like `ask_followup_question`, `attempt_completion`, or MCP tools) results in two errors:

1. __Primary error__: `tool_use is not supported yet. Received: {"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_...","name":"ask_followup_question","input":{...}}`
2. __Secondary error__: `Error: Current ask promise was ignored` at Task.ask (line 666)

__Expected behavior__: Interactive tools should execute properly, prompting the user for input and continuing the task flow.


### Steps to reproduce

1. Configure Cline to use Claude Code as the API provider
2. Start a task that requires user interaction (e.g., ask Cline to make a choice between options)
3. When the AI attempts to use `ask_followup_question` or any tool that requires user interaction
4. Observe the "tool_use is not supported yet" error in console
5. See the task fail with "Current ask promise was ignored" error



### Provider/Model

cline:claude-code/claude-sonnet-4.5-20250929

### System Information

###

__Operating System__: macOS Sequoia 
__IDE__: VSCodium 
__Note__: This issue affects the backward compatibility path in the Claude Code provider (when handling messages without the `--include-partial-messages` flag). The modern path handles tool_use correctly.

title: Context Window Usage Mismatch - UI shows ~50% but API receives 100% (100K token discrepancy)
body:
### Plugin Type

VSCode Extension

### Cline Version

3.36.1

### What happened?

The UI displayed approximately 50% context usage (~100K tokens), suggesting plenty of headroom remaining. However, the actual API request contained 200,926 tokens - double what the UI indicated - causing an unexpected "prompt is too long: 200926 tokens > 200000 maximum" error.

**Expected Behavior**: The UI context percentage should accurately reflect the actual tokens sent to the API, allowing users to proactively manage context before hitting limits.

**Actual Behavior**: The UI showed ~100K tokens (~50% usage) while the API received 200,926 tokens (>100% of the 200K limit), resulting in task failure without warning.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Start a conversation with ~15 messages performing simple tasks (e.g., debugging display bug)
2. Read 2 JavaScript files (total 1,850 lines)
3. Share 3 screenshots during the conversation
4. Observe UI showing ~50% context usage (~100K tokens indicated)
5. Continue working until API request fails
6. Error received: "prompt is too long: 200926 tokens > 200000 maximum"

**Note**: No heavy operations were performed - no database queries, recursive file listings, or extensive file searches. The task was straightforward debugging work.

### Provider/Model

anthropic / claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929

### System Information

Visual Studio Code: 1.105.1, Node.js: v22.19.0, Architecture: arm64

title: /smol command fails when context window is overfed during task execution
body:
### Plugin Type

VSCode Extension

### Cline Version

3.36.1

### What happened?

The `/smol` command doesn't work when the context window is overfed. Instead of compacting the context, it gets skipped during task execution because the context is already consumed. The user expected the `/smol` command to take precedence and compact the context window even when in the middle of a task execution chain.

Special detail on, how the "tools" are appended before any important and more important action to enact.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Start a long-running task that consumes significant context window
2. Continue working until context window is nearly full/overfed
3. Try to use `/smol` command to compact context
4. Observe that the command is ignored/skipped because context is already consumed by ongoing task execution

### Provider/Model

vscode-lm / grok-code-fast-1

### System Information

Visual Studio Code: 1.105.1, Node.js: v22.19.0, Architecture: x64
